items.title: The Week in Ransomware - November 11th 2022 - LockBit feeling the heat
items.description: This 'Week in Ransomware' covers the last two weeks of ransomware news, with new information on attacks, arrests, data wipers, and reports shared by cybersecurity firms and researchers. [...]
items.content: This 'Week in Ransomware' covers the last two weeks of ransomware news, with new information on attacks, arrests, data wipers, and reports shared by cybersecurity firms and researchers. [...]
items.creator: Lawrence Abrams

items.title: Microsoft Defender network protection generally available on iOS, Android
items.description: Microsoft announced that the Mobile Network Protection feature is generally available to help organizations detect network weaknesses affecting Android and iOS devices running Microsoft's Defender for Endpoint (MDE) enterprise endpoint security platform. [...]

items.title: An $8 mess — Twitter Blue 'verified' accounts push crypto scams
items.description: Twitter has officially rolled out its Twitter Blue program for an $8 monthly fee that confers upon the Tweeter multiple benefits, including the much-sought blue badge. But, all this has led to its own set of problems, such as threat actors now impersonating famous people and still being granted a "verified" status. [...]
items.content: Twitter has officially rolled out its Twitter Blue program for an $8 monthly fee that confers upon the Tweeter multiple benefits, including the much-sought blue badge. But, all this has led to its own set of problems, such as threat actors now impersonating famous people and still being granted a "verified" status. [...]
items.creator: Ax Sharma
